speaker: President.
english:
President. Thank you very much to everybody who has spoken. The Council and the Commission have been able to hear the political groups, who have expressed differing degrees of dissatisfaction, in some cases satisfactory dissatisfaction and in others dissatisfaction pure and simple. They have also been able to hear an appeal for work to continue with a view to providing the Union with a system of own resources which in future budgetary negotiations will put an end to the haggling based on national self-interests to which several group chairmen have referred.
Mr Schüssel, we would like to urge you to continue along this road which you have bravely outlined. We are sure that that is where the Union’s future lies, with better budgets so that the Union can achieve its objectives. The political groups will discuss the agreement that our negotiators have reached on its behalf and Parliament will vote on it during its next part-session.
That concludes this item.
Written statement (Rule 142)
original:
President. Thank you very much to everybody who has spoken. The Council and the Commission have been able to hear the political groups, who have expressed differing degrees of dissatisfaction, in some cases satisfactory dissatisfaction and in others dissatisfaction pure and simple. They have also been able to hear an appeal for work to continue with a view to providing the Union with a system of own resources which in future budgetary negotiations will put an end to the haggling based on national self-interests to which several group chairmen have referred.
Mr Schüssel, we would like to urge you to continue along this road which you have bravely outlined. We are sure that that is where the Union’s future lies, with better budgets so that the Union can achieve its objectives. The political groups will discuss the agreement that our negotiators have reached on its behalf and Parliament will vote on it during its next part-session.
That concludes this item.
Written statement (Rule 142)
agenda_item: State of progress of negotiations on the Financial Perspective. (debate)
